reviewText:
Thus far I've put about 25 hours into this game and most of that has been with a grin on my face! The rest of the time is likely me spitting out expletives when the AI/police instantly wreck my car with a modest tap...

In short though as a fan of Carmageddon since the first one came out (the first full priced game I bought no less) I feel that with the recent updates, it has finally made this a game befitting of its name. I reluctantly held off all the way through the Kickstarter campaign and early access, fearing it may lead to complacency and indeed the 'FINAL' update sounded pretty disappointing even though it was obvious that there was a good game underneath. So I waited and waited and I'm pleased to say that it was indeed finally worth the wait.

Carmageddon 2 still has the best damage though... but the damage in Reincarnation isn't far off and the tank tracks are pretty awesome.

Here's hoping the updates continue!

reviewText:
Well, I'm not happy to say that even with the immense support from the community we got what we were hoping for: A fun, polished, well balanced game, with very little problems that could be overlooked that is pretty much a reboot of the first incarnation of carma.

TL;DR at the very bottom.

Here is a list of issues I have gathered thus far:

-Long load times, at times nearing 5 minutes.

-Your car is the weakest, least manuverable car, whichever one you choose to drive. Perhaps upgrades will help, but even then I dont think there is an incentive to upgrade any car until you get either your favorite one or the Electric Blue.

-Taking hits from opponent AI gets you terribly disfigured, disabled, or killed. While giving hits barely gets you that satisfying crunch of wasting your opponent with a well aimed ram. I was unable to destroy an AI racer while it was sitting helpless on its top, after 3 60mph hits, I gave up and moved on.

-Hitting mines from the map = 95% chance for death.

-Slowly hitting peds only knocks them around instead of killing them. They should just die from just touching them no matter how fast you're going. Many times, I was going fast enough to kill myself and have peds bounce off. It's a flesh wound!"

-Where is the workshop? Boasting of custom cars in the alpha stage
date: now nowhere to be seen. Would've loved to drive in many fun cars like the batmobile

- Moving around the stage select screen is a disaster. Why not move and highlight with a cursor or joystick? forced using keyboard to move and trigger and bumper buttons for the xbox controller.

What I liked about the CR:

-The racers look good. Though textures can be extremely muddy. Perhaps this may be because I turn them down to the lowest setting in hopes of lowering load times.

reviewText:
For me Carmageddon: Reincarnation is on a tie with the first Carmageddon as best game of the series.

Between the sheer fun factor of just fu***ng around, or the many different game modes which are all tons of fun and a breath of fresh air to the game, replay value is very high and you're not about to stop playing.

The AI adversaries actually matter in this one, which is something Carma1 really lacked.

Sadly, the environments don't feel as varied to me as they were in Carma1, and the game still has some annoying bugs:
-In MANY levels, you'll find pedestrians stuck in the decor.
-Also some achievements are broken, which actually mean a lot since they unlock collectibles in the game.
-From times to times you'll see the world disappear for a split second (or more, depending on where you stand and where you look at).
-And finally, it also crashes from times to times.

A great game but those bugs come ruining the experience a little. Quite a shame, especially considering that if you look online a little, these glitches were reported by several people summer 2015 and were not fixed in the christmas update....

reviewText: I really wanted to like this game.  I throughly enjoyed the originals, and in terms of core gameplay, this is right on par.  However that's not where the game is lacking.  This game is lacking in the execution.  Load times are simply abysmal, there is simply no reason for levels to take 1-2 minutes to load on a system that exceeds recommended specs.  Framerates are wildly unstable, in order to maintain 60fps on my GTX970 I basically have to turn everything to low.  I really hope they correct these issues, but given how this is the exact same experience I had in the alpha, closed beta, and open beta.  I'm not holding my breath.

reviewText: If you are a Carma fan, then you should already have this game. If you are for some reason waiting to see if it's worthy of the Carma name, it is. It's a great Carmageddon game. If you are new to the series, then maybe you don't know what Carmageddon is all about. You are placed in a large open map with other cars, and you want to be the first to either wreck everybody, finish all the checkpoints (and all laps), or kill all the pedestrians (a goal that is hard to do, but a badge of honor to do it). In classic single player Carma, you need to satisfy one of these objectives before time runs out. Time can be increased by causing chaos like killing people or hitting other cars. While you can race, this isn't really a racing game. It's hard to really say what it is. Watch some gameplay and see. There's lots of neat powerups, and maps and cars. The game also has a very silly, if not crude at times, sense of humor. I wouldn't recommend it to people who just want a straight racing game, but for people who just want car chaos, I would go for it, there's tons of that, and the cool damage system means that there will be parts flying everywhere.\n\nThe only con is that there are still a little bit of technical problems, mostly optimization stuff, but if you're getting this a while after it is out, that should all be hammered out.

reviewText:
Good ole Carmageddon but with modern day graphics. I haven't played enough to really write up a full review yet but I did play on and off throughout Early Access.

I can confirm that the game engine has been what I would call Acceptably Optimized. I'm not sure if they had to cut out some graphical features or not, but what i can tell is that the game runs just fine at max settings now. During previous builds you were lucky to get a decent framerate with half settings, that is no longer an issue! So if you were worried about performance before, I say the game feels just fine now and I'm running a first gen unlocked Intel i5 at max overclock speed. (Same as i7) Worrying about RAM is kinda meaningless these days in the sense that it's ridiculously cheap. I have 8GB of RAM which does just fine.

tl;dr: If you like Carmageddon 1 and/or Carmageddon 2: Carpocalypse Now, you will like this game. It doesn't attempt to re-invent the wheel, it's just a good remake with even more crazy modifiers and maps, also online multiplayer which I haven't tried out yet.

reviewText:
Awesome remake of the original game (and if you're old like me and remember how much fun the original was - it's just as good, no, better than the original! Which is high praise!!!.)

This game is just fun fun fun - win by racing, win by mass homicide, or win by attrition. You decide how you want to play /drive and take it from there. I love knocking opponents cars into oncoming obstacles or cliff edges and the power ups are hilarious.

NOT for young kids though.... you get to run down all kinds of pedestrians including tarts, dogs, grannies and cows. Very bloody but in an insane hilarious way that only video games can pull off. Great humour built into the commentary and also awesome sound tracks to race to.

LOVE IT.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Yep, it's Carmageddon... and it's going to be awesome.

--

Above is my Early Access Review. I had meant to come back when the full game releases and give my impressions of it. I was surprised to discover that I completely missed this game leaving Early Access.

Do I still recommend it? Yes. Is it awesome? ... kinda. But it certainly is Carmageddon, and those searching for a nostalgic foray into car smashing and pedestrian killing shouldn't be disappointed.

This game did suffer some performance issues in early access, and judging from reviews it took a while for them to fix it. Some would probably say for the level of fidelity Carmageddon overtaxes their computers. This game performs slightly better than Arkham Knight for me, but with significantly less visual pizzazz.

The gameplay is spot-on for a Carmageddon game, though the cars feel a little sluggish at times. The healing mechanic feels a bit overpowered, and I would have liked to see the ability to heal yourself replaced with health powerups scattered throughout the level. The AI doesn't seem to heal themselves, so they have a massive disadvantage in some game modes.

Despite my criticism I feel like this game is worth the asking price and I absolutely enjoyed the time I spent in it.

reviewText:
As much as it pains me to write this I can't recommend this game in its current state.  The game is just too poorly optimized.  The devs said their goal was to get their engine up to 30fps... I don't think this is an acceptable bar for 2015.  The devs did say they will now try to work it up to the 60fps bar as they weren't aware 30 fps was a bad goal to aim for for release.  If that does happen I will gladly change my review but in its current state there is no way I could recommend the game to friends.

The gameplay is extremely fun and does represent the old Carmageddon in a good way, but the poor optimization is what is really holding this one back and kills the game.  I have a decent system(i7 2600K stable oced to 4.4ghz, 2Xr9 270x in crossfire, 16gb of ram) and struggle to get a stable 30fps.  This game is not graphically intensive at all and shouldn't be giving my system problems.

EDIT: A patch has finally been released which improves the games optimization a TON!  Great job Stainless!

reviewText:
-------------------------------------------------------------
This is NOT Early Access review, It's 1.0.
-------------------------------------------------------------

It runs very bad even on a very good PC and even running from a Solid State Drive it takes forever to load and when it does load it keeps freezing where it is still loading assets. If you restart a race it takes ages to load again.

I am pretty sure the sound affects are taken right out of Carmageddon TDR 2000, especially the car engine sounds, which are poor quality and give me a headache. Which is strange because CarmaTDR2k was not made by the same people.

The game is also borring.
The cars are 10x more fragile then in previous carmageddon games and i find i am playing while holding the repair button for the whole race.
The cars are very slow and it feels like you never get up to any speed.
The AI cars just won't leave you alone for 2 seconds, they are relentles and it makes chasing checkpoints a waste of time because before you go through all of them, the AI are normally dead. So you can forget about killilg all the peds because that will probably never happen.

You can not modify the controls for the gamepad apart from 3 templates which all suck. The right stick controls the camera, but you can only look where they want you too, so you cannot look behind you.

The most anoying thing about the game is how fragile the cars are. In carma 1 the cars were alot stronger and it took a while to kill a AI but the players cars were stronger too but now the AI can hit the player once and your wasted. after you get wasted you can repair and keep driving which feels like i am cheating because the AI can't do it, so why can i? by the end of most races i end up with negitive credits, and it does not even seem to matter.

Carmageddon 1,2 and 3 are far better then this version.
A few months ago i played carma1 and i could not put it down until i finnished it but i get bored with this one before the first race is over.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very true and faithful to the very first two Carmageddon games. The old 1 gen cars even make a cameo appearence on one of the tracks (AMAZING!). The game was built for modders and gamers alike, as the devs are very open to the opinion of those who play the game. They've re-done many of the old tracks and are remaking all the old cars before they go on to make new ones it would seem. If you've played the first Carma you will recognize the tracks almost immediately and begin to explore just like you did the first time. The physics and damage are superb, as is the sound track and sound FX. If you ever liked Carma, you will not be dissappointed! This game is the perfect love letter to those memories of your past childhood. This game- still in alpha, is better than anything that EA or the Need For Speed series has done.

See you on the road.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So, I've made a positive review about this game when it was in early access, then I made a negative one when it was released and now I've changed back to a positive review... what's up with that?

My point was that the game was good as an early access game, with all the predictable shortcomings and whatsnot. The problem is that this game was more or less released with all the aforementioned problems still existing. BUT after some updates this game runs as you would expect and it's Carmageddon allright!

Pro's:
- Fitting soundtrack (actually: a fantastic soundtrack, both for metalheads and techno lovers)
- Eagle and Hawk are well designed
- A lot of cars from previous series (Stig-o-sore, Screwie-lewie)
- A lot of powerups from previous series, some of them with visual effects as well (Bouncy bouncy,
- Some powerups change the look of your car (ie: Solid granite car)
- Levels of cops: the enforcer to fear, the mini-cop cars to smash.
- Cool repair effect: the parts of your car fly back together
- You win cars pretty fast, you don't have to be super-lucky like in carma1
- Perfect controller support

new pro's after the update:
- While a bit more demanding than previous carmageddon versions, the physics are now enjoyable.
- Most of the cars look good
- The load times are a bit longish but nothing too bad (not Fallout 4 alike)
- The damage model is wonderfull
- Weapons on cars actually work, you can slice people with your eagle hawk, or pop tires with Val Hella's cleaver

Con's:
- I miss the prat cam :(
- While the tracks are OK, you drive around on them way too often
- Checkpoint stampede and kill the specific pedestrian are virtually the same game mode
- New enemies aren't interesting, but the old ones are very good

While it might not be THE installment every carmageddon fan wished for it's definatly a good one. I'm hoping for a sequel with refreshing new cars and tracks, an equally good soundtrack and a bleeping prat cam!
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
(DISCLAIMER - This review may change if some of the main issues are being addressed and actually worked on.) Original review posted on 22 May, 2015. Updated 18 May, 2016

UPDATED!

First of all I want to thank the developer, Tracy for making me revisit the game after their recent major update. It took me a while, but I'm a man of my word. I just re-revisited it (at the time I'm writing this update I'm enjoying Reincarnation a lot and will push it through all chapters!), and I can happily say the game is now way, way, waaay better. My main issue when I made this review was with performance. My rant list was consisted of other things as well, but since then a lot has been greatly improved. Sure I can't say I still like everything, but damn, it's starting to feel like a real game now. They really improved the performance significantly. It plays excellent now! It's stable, less buggy, it sounds more crisp...It's..It's... It's ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•in' CARMAGEDDON! Let's leave it to that!

A big thank you to Stainless Games for keeping their word and not betraying their loyal fans and backers!

My old rants can still be found down there for all to read. I still miss something from the original, but all in all Reincarnation ain't that bad of a game after all! My old negative review just turned into a positive one!


As a hardcore and truly loyal fan of the original Carmageddon (the first game in the series 1997. Note: I'm gonna refer back to it a lot) I have to say that Reincarnation is an insult to the first game, and literally a middle finger salute for all loyal backers who believed in this game (including myself). I don't expect to have a copy of the original, but all that hype Reincarnation had and it was supposed to deliver failed (at least for now). Stainless made their cash and we all got suckered, you know how it goes nowadays. Seriously though, releasing a game in a state Reincarnation is now is almost criminal.

If looking back at the early access development, I must say it hasn't gotten much better. I feel like this game is still early access / early alpha. It took Stainless Games over a year before they made it to full final version" as they like to call it now. All I see now is the content being more complete among with some bugs and crash issues being fixed which is a good thing of course
recommended: the performance remains and is still a major issue. Even when running this hog with an ASUS ROG it is simply not possible to enjoy this game the way you should be. Despite the atrocious performance
hoursPlayed:
I want to release some steams now and tell you about some other things wrong with this product.


CARMAGEDDON WORLD

Basically my biggest issue with this game is the actual feel. It doesn't feel like Carmageddon. Sure there's a lot of familiar cars and drivers from the past to get that homey feeling
voteText: but all those little things that made the original -97 game so damn awesome and memorable simply don't exist under this title. Like
helpfulPercent: how did they left out the classic and much loved pratcam? I don't feel like I'm Max Damage behind the wheel anymore. Be it the time schedule or just pure laziness as the reason
votesHelpful: but people at Stainless Games were not thinking straight. The world of Carmageddon in Reincarnation is simply uninspired and dull to look at. What happened to the original idea and feel of an apocalyptic world around you? I'm not saying all tracks are bad
votesTotal:
but pretty much majority of the locations where tracks now take place resemble more like a theme park with a preset setting. Gone are all those crazy-long super highways with insane speed impacts (DOWNTOWN DEVASTATION anyone? :p) ...of course without forgetting twisty urban city scenery and all those underground locations calling for ultimate mayhem and destruction!

CIVILIANS

Civilians in the Carmageddon world always count as points and time. Not only they can be annoying and fun at the same time
votesFunny: but it's always been fun as hell to drive over them. All that aggression and steam you get to release when taking down a flock of them will put a smile on your lunatic face. Unfortunately the NPC's in Reincarnation are so lame. The satisfaction of killing... no
commentsCount: slaughtering does not exist anymore. Now it feel's like I'm taking down paper dolls which don't come even close to look like a human. I really miss those old "splatty" sprite characters from -97. Ramming NPC's at 200 MPH made their spines spin like crazy
column16:
and the fast speed only made the impact sound even louder!

GAME AUDIO & MUSIC

Fear Factory - Zero Signal. YEAH! Naturally for the nostalgia sake they included the same track in this game
column17: but that only gave me the false impression that this game may actually be decent. Music is hot topic and a matter of opinion
column18: but to be frank here
column19: I don't like this Dubstep they included now. Luckily I can shut off the music I don't like and put my own
column20: problem solved. Unfortunately the game audio is a bit bigger problem. Alright
column21: let's start with the car sounds. In a game like Carmageddon the engine sound is present all the time. You pretty much listen to it from the very moment the race starts and ends. In -97 pretty much every car was unique and almost each of them had their own sounds and they sounded just as you would expect. Well
column22: Reincarnation lacks this quality. I noticed they recycled Max's Red Eagle engine sound on multiple cars. I understand this might still be a minor thing for some people
column23: but for me hearing the same sound coming from 70% of my competitors drives me nuts. And to top it off
column24: the engine sound is utterly ridiculous
column25: it's just so bad! I would expect to get some nasty rumble exhaust and screams of turbos and superchargers instead of lame monotone sounding vacuum cleaners. Needless to say here
column26: I'm also very disappointed with all light collision and heavy impact sounds. In -97 you could feel and hear twisting
column27: sparking and scrub sounds when the metal pushed against metal. It was tingling and aggressive
column28: but satisfying as hell. Now it's hard to tell whenever you actually do real damage or not because of the faint impact sounds. Same apply on civilians. Instead of loud limb explosions it's just "POFF*. The whole idea of Carmageddon is to be violent. When I'm having the momentum with a heavy vehicle doing top speed and going for a head on collision vs some rice cake car. I want to hear it's chassis batter to pieces LOUDLY
column30:
and to see a ton of tiny bits and material flying all over the place when cutting through it! YOU WASTED 'EM!

SUMMARY

Despite some of the things I don't like
column31: I still want to give this game a try
column33: because it's Carmageddon! But before that can happen
column34: Stainless crew needs to focus on making the game playable with at least a reasonable frame rate
column35: then that'll change a lot of things. They made one of the best games of all time in the late 90's. I think the fans and all backers deserve to enjoy a fully functional game. Only you can make this happen

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Carmageddon: Reincarnation is a reimagined version of Carmageddon 1 and 2, but with today standards.
Even in it's current beta state, this game got the best destruction and crash physics for a car game. Each cars is unique and beautifully designed, tracks are cool with lots of exploration, skidmarks, debris, junk, limbs and severed pedestrians remains in the track and do not magically vanishes like in games ala GTA.
It is a car combat game, not a racing game, even if you can win by racing, you will be able to win by wrecking every opponents, or if you have the courage, by killing every pedestrians.
Just be warned, the game is not fully optimized yet, so you will need a beefy PC, with lots of Vram, and you will encounter bugs.
Bear in mind Stainless Games is not a Triple-A company, so no, pedestrians will not be as good looking as those from GTA5, but they are satisfaying enough when the blood splat all over your car after you landed on the hood by doing a rolliong crash. There are penguins to slaughter too.

I grew up with Carmageddon. It was only necessary that I get Reincarnation as soon as fiscally possible. And my first word when thrown into the game was: SLLLOOOOWWWW. My computer is brand spanking new, with (what I THOUGHT were) high specs. Reincarnation threw them straight out the window. So I thought I had the settings on very high, and that was why it was so slow.

They were on medium.

I said, I might as well start at Ultra Low settings
date: just to see what I can improve." So I changed to Ultra Low. It made no difference! The game struggles to hold a consistent frame rate
recommended: and it only worsens when there's more terrain on the screen.\n\nBut I'm thumbing it up because it's early access! Room and time for improvement and whatnot! Stainless says it themselves in the Early Access description: "...refining and optimising all the underlying proprietary core rendering and engine code in order to make the game run smoother." I suppose I'll just be patient for the time being."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I backed the kickstarter, but only at the lowest level. I had doubts about the team's ability to make a Carmageddon that doesn't suck.

I was wrong. I was very wrong. I am filled with shame. This game is awesome.

So we're in Beta now, and this is very much old school Carmageddon. It looks great, I'm getting pleasingly good frame rates (admittedly with a pretty pimped out system), and in general it's more fun than running a barrel over monkeys.

I play using keyboard controls because 1) I've been doing that since Carma 1, 2) the controller doesn't have a wheelspin button, and 3) I have a thrustmaster controller with the buttons in different locations, that can not be remapped. Cars handle like old school Carma, so if you like that, you're great. Maybe a tiny bit twitchier because of the higher frame rates, actually.

reviewText:
Short video:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=449875353

Long video:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=449875360

Are you a sexual tyrannosaurus who eats iron bars for breakfast? Of course you ****ing are!
(Translation: Did you love the original Carmageddon? Get this, you won't be sorry).

THE GOOD:

Seriously? It's f'ing Carmaf'ingeddon. What more do you f'ing want? It's violent, it's crazy, it's downright bloody stupid at times, and most of all it's fun. In fact no, it's FUUUNNNN!!!!!!
You want a racing game where you can smash your opponents in various amusing and sadistic ways?
Do you just want to go on a rampage and run over hundreds of innocent civilians, but don't want to do the jail time?
Maybe you want to turn cows into burger patties by power sliding through them?
Or how about crazy suicidal stunt jumps across city rooftops with no consequences?
Insane power ups that border on absurdity?
Or maybe, just maybe: You liked the original Carmageddon and have been longing, no; itching for a return to the vehicular slaughter that so many other games have tried (and failed) to impersonate.

THE BAD:

Some people have stability issues.
Some people have performance issues - I'm not, running an FX8350, 8GB DDR3 and a GTX760 and it's running pretty well for me on the better performance" preset (not quite lowest settings which would be the "best performance preset")
date: 1920x1080; not brilliant but certainly very playable performance wise
recommended: around 50-90 fps which is better than I can get any of the old games to run in dosbox lol.\nLoading times are ridiculously long if you're using an HDD (recently moved it to an SSD and it's miles better).\nMultiplayer is apparently problematic too at the moment with connection issues etc (haven't tried it myself yet
hoursPlayed: I want to master all of the maps first). Updates are slow to come (but they do happen
voteText: and when they do they bring improvements in performance
helpfulPercent: add features etc)."
votesHelpful: March 10, 2015
votesTotal: true

reviewText:
Reincarnation is fun, but only maybe a standard deviation moreso than say Duke Nukem Forever for example.

Both have great history and both are jumping a huge generation gap, and try to re-convey their original humor, gameplay mechanics and concept. DNF fails almost always, but Reincarnation for the most part pulls off the gameplay loops that were the most fun in the older games.

The driving mechanics STILL are just wonky, and controllable at best. It is still a struggle to be preceise, and in a good portion of circumstances less so than in C2. The physics feels a lot better, but they don't feel seperate enough from the driving system to make it precise.

The graphics are a significant jump, but not that impressive and do not warrant the inconsistant framerate on lesser hardware. Even on a 980ti, there are times where it runs just marginally well, while most are buttery smooth... on a 980ti! My 680FTW+ 4GB struggled to keep a successful framerate however while maxed out.

The humor is still there for the most part, but either due to getting older, or the humor just not aging well (which is up to you), it just doesn't make me laugh as it once did.

The vehicles look decent, but i would have appreciated some more creativity, grunginess and slapstick.
I wish the powerups were more projectile and less stupid gimicky jokes. Too many of them are the same or do something completely useless. When i'm trying to finish off the last competitior, all i want is a slaughter mortar, but i find 30 kangaroo on commands instead. The onlyadvantage this time around is that you can straight up buy your powerups if youve made enough cash. It would have been great if there could have been some new fail states and if they could have let the enemies use power ups on you for a change without breaking what fun there is to be had.

I got this with the pack of C1, C2 and 3 all together for a decent pre-release price and i feel like that was a good value. I don't know if that deal is still going on, but i don't think i would have bought it if it didn't include all the others. C2 and 3 are still my favorites, but this is interesting and fun enough to keep me coming back when i feel like letting loose on peds and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• drivers.

I can only barely recommend, but only on a sale and maybe if the bundle is still for sale.

reviewText:
ive been a carmageddon fan since the beginning, loved all the games so far. reincarnation takes the cake!! the physics are so sloppy.

-no traction. it feels like driving on ice all the time
-my car is fully upgraded and is as slow as a smart car
-the car flips over if it hits a bump
-wheels fall off when an opponent touches you
-the opponent AI is a joke, their strategy is to drive against you relentlessly pushing you around the map and you cant even get traction to get away

i could go on about little things but ill stop there. its really frustrating playing this game for a long time even though i enjoy carmageddon. the maps are great, the cars look awesome. smashing peds is a blast, especially with the new items. overall recommended.

Thank you Stainless. i hope you consider this review and use it to fine tune any future updates you do!  :D

reviewText:
I've been playing this game since early access, may as well add a review for it.

First and foremost, you're going to need a good computer for this. If you don't have one, you're probably going to have a few troubles. As the description states, check your PC specification against the required specifications.

It's come a long way. With every update, the game has become more optimised, much nicer looking, and more and more worthy of being a part of the Carmageddon series. It feels much like the older games, with a new coat of paint and some neat features. And the soundtrack, my god the soundtrack.

I can't recommend this any higher, and I'd go even further to recommending getting the complete pack so you can remember the good ol' days too!

reviewText:
IT'S BACK.

The game that turned racing sims upside-down and sent video-game violence pundits into fits has been retooled for the 21st Century. Unlike a lot of remakes, I can safely say Carma 2014 is even more violent, over-the-top, crude, and amusing than the original. It's only in pre-alpha right now, but it's playable enough to see that this will be the type of nonsensically-amusing, tongue-in-cheek, unabashedly politically-incorrect game that the industry sorely needs in a time of more or less unimaginative, derivative crap.

This year, get ready to hang on to yer helmet, and keep that squeegee handy to wipe the entrails off the rear-view.

8.5/10

reviewText:
Pros
+++++
Graphics
concept
different play modes
open arenas
repairing
tons of violence
awesome stunts
creative car designs

cons
--------

power ups are mainly placed offroad
Cars are too slow

Suggestions
-+-+-+

Slamming into cars is a dull way to attack them. A gun mount would have changed everything. I can't imagine the mainstream buying this game as it's not very streamlined. I'm probably too generous since I like it mainly for the violence and stunts,

reviewText:
A worthy successor of Carpocalypse Now.

I bought it after the performance improvements patch, because I don't have a gaming PC, but I play it with 60+ FPS (yep 120Hz monitor), here is how:

CPU - Intel Core i5-4460
RAM - Kingston FURY Memory Blue - 8GB Kit* DDR3 1600MHz
SSD - Intel¬Æ SSD 530 Series (180GB, 2.5in SATA 6Gb/s)
VGA - GeForce GTX 750 GPU 128-bit with only 1GB RAM!

The entire PC (without peripherals) cost me just about $750 (US dollars) in April 2015.

I have everything set up to LOW and OFF and I play it on 1360x768 resolution in window mode. I also have everything set up to performance in Nvidia control panel. I have only the ped and the world distance set to MID.

Even on this low end settings the game is still a blast when you play it with 60+ FPS!

The only bug that I've found so far is that when I take too many powerups the vertical powerup bar that notifies you about new or active powerups bugs out, and it stays that way until you're wrecked, and you wait for the game to recover you, hence when all of your powerups are lost.

reviewText:
I bought this game one sale in beta. Due to the performance issues and numerous bugs/oddities I didn't review the game back then but it didn't stop me from finishing the game. This is a true carmageddon game and so it is addictive. I didn't play the game since the retail version was released. I haven't seen update 1 and didn't expect much when I tried the second update. I feared the developers bet on the wrong engine and couldn't do much about the bugs and hiccups.

Luckily this is not the case. This version fixes almost everything and gives the game a much needed performance boost while updating graphics! Gone are gameplay affecting bugs like stuck powerup effects slowing things down and collision weirdness. My only complaint left is the loading time. While it's not outlandish anymore it is still long on slower processors (it seems CPU is the bottleneck here not HDD/SSD). The game starts as soon as it finishes loading. I prefer a <<press any key when ready>> message so I can walk away/do something else in the meanwhile.

Other than that, highly recommended!

reviewText: Put simply, this is what the first X Carmageddon games would have been if technology was no issue. Just as crass (if not a little more so), just as hectic, just as fun to play, but with SO MUCH MORE POLISH. Fantastic fidelity, the same cast of memorable characters/cars, and a few nice extra features like a super robust replay mode, and a ton of new powers that add a bit more fun. This game is exactly what gaming does best, escapism. Get into a weird, wacky car, and just do what you like. Want to be the best racer and post the best times? You can, and are rewarded for it. Want to wreck every opponent you see? You can, and are equally rewarded. Want to kill every squishy living thing on the map? You guessed it, rewards all around. It's a playground of destruction and ridiculousness, and I not only thoroughly enjoy the play, but I absolutely laughed out loud quite a few times. Highly recommended.

Carmageddon 1 and 2 were some of my favorite games in the 90's and were some of the first PC games I played. I learned my lesson not to trust this dev 100% with a few of the follow ups (looking at you TDR 2000).After backing this game in early access and testing it out last year it seemed like it had promise, but was pretty rough around the edges. After it left early access I heard it had a bad start due to poor optimization, so I held off on playing it.

Finally gave it a try today and it's a total blast. Optimization seems great, getting solid 60fps+ (on 980ti). The new game modes are fantastic.

A must buy.

I used to really enjoy the two original Carmageddon games back in the days, but was horribly disappointed by TDR 2000, which shouldn't be surprising, as the franchise had been taken over by a different developer.
However, when I head that Stainless Games were going to do a new sequel to Carmageddon II, I got really excited.

So, now that the final game has been out for a while, what do I think of it?
Well, if you loved Carmageddon 1 and 2, then chances are you'll enjoy this one as well. If you expect realistic driving phyiscs and racing wheel support and such, then you'll be sorely disappointed, becuse that is not what Carmageddon in about. It's a free for all kill anything that moves" type game
date: and if you go into it with that in mind
recommended: it can be a whole lot of fun. I'm not sure if I like all of the new race types
hoursPlayed: but hey
voteText: you don't have to play career mode
helpfulPercent: so you can choose to just play the type of races you prefer.\n\nThis isn't the type of game you delve into for hours on end. It's a quick fix of fun madness
votesHelpful: and as such I think it works really well. If you're familiar with the old ones
votesTotal: you'll know what you get. Carmageddon II: Carpocalypse Now is probably still my favourite of the series
votesFunny: but it's more than "a bit" long in the tooth by now
commentsCount:
and doesn't really look that impressive anymore.

There are some flaws with this game though.
I am somebody who suffers from issues with motion sickness from first person shooters and similar games. I don't normally have those types of problems with driving games (I can play Assetto Corsa for hours without any issues)
column16: but Carmageddon: Reincarnated can quite easily give me motion sickness (and I tend to get it quite bad)
column17: but this isn't an issue that will affect the majority of gamers I expect. I wanted to mention it anyway though.\nMore important is the fact that this game has some pretty steep system requirements. When I first tried it out
column18: I had a Radeon HD6870 CrossFire setup on an i7 920@3.78GHz
column19: and it was totally unplayable. We're talking slideshow (5fps
column20: sometimes a lot less) even at the lowest of settings. Upgrading to a Radeon R9 280x made the game playable
column21: but still not completely smooth. It did allow me to run my native resolution though (1920x1200 for me)
column22: and the game looks great even on lower settings. In fact
column23: I find a lof othe blur effects used for "depth perspective" and such to look absolutely horrible and make my head go funny.\nI am currently running an i7 6700k @ 4.7GHz
column24: 32GB DDR4 and an R9 Fury. My steam drive is a Samsung 850 EVO and although the game now runs "pretty well"
column25: there are still occasional fps dips. If you haven't got a pretty badass gaming PC
column26: then you can probably forget about running this game.\n\nTL;DR - This is pretty much "more of the same"
column28: it's hard to really fault it. Carmageddon is good fun. Great for short sessions of complete mayhem
column29: if you have the system specs to run it that is."

Came back to retry after about a year or so, and OMG the differance is amazing.
Runs almost perfectly, I get very few frame spikes.
Sound track is awesome, pickups are alot of fun... except turning my car to glass.... that sucks balls!
Campaign is alot of fun, only gripe is that the car unlock / upgrade system is a bit weak and systemic. I prefered the originals version where you had a chance on smashing to steal the car, but whatever its no big deal!
If you like carmageddon, you need this in your life

reviewText:
If you're feeling particularly sadistic and want a good, satisfying time-waster, this is a game I'd highly recommend. It started off with pretty rough beginnings, not being very well-optimized and running like crap for most people, plus updates were very slow... to the point people thought that this game was abandonware. However, each update brought something massive to the table: performance upgrades, graphics upgrades, new content, etc. Now this game runs buttery smooth, and it's bursting with content to use and mess around with. The devs truly care about their product, and they seem to be quite determined to make it even better.

First off, the career can be a bit repetitive, but unlocking everything can be quite satisfying. However, if playing through the career (and also completing various challenges) to unlock things doesn't really float your boat, the CarMODgeddon mode allows you to have free use of everything from the get-go with the added support of mods, which can also be used in multiplayer.

Multiplayer is a bit bare-bones at the moment, but it's still quite fun if you want to screw around with a few friends. There's unfortunately no local multiplayer, but hopefully that'll be added in the future. There are also some glitches here and there regarding things like challenges, so it can be a bit irritating if you're a completionist.

Despite some shortcomings, this game is just pure fun. There are a variety of modes, and the main mode Classic Carma" can be beaten through either racing
recommended: or the difficult (but satisfying) challenge of killing all of the pedestrians. Powerups are scattered about

reviewText: At first I thought I was going to be disappointed by this game, because I read so many poor comments about it. After I got it I was unmoveable (if such a word exists, well it should.) for over an hour and a half as played this. I like how they've revamped everything and introduced some new features along the way. I'm glad some of the opponents from the original are in this, like Ivan, Madam Scarlett, Stella Stunna and The Brothers Grimm, because they didn't go over into Carmageddon 2 or Carmageddon TDR2000. They REALLY have gone to town on the vehicles, they're way, way, WAY better than any previous version. The only thing I didn't like was how you had to collect tokens to upgrade your car. The parts shop on the original is STILL the best. I gave this a 9 out of 10.

reviewText:
This Game has got huge promise. It has many problems i can forgive such as load times, somewhat mixed proformance on my gtx 980ti.

It is let down on some of the basics, such as the handling on the vehicles is very poor, and while the physics can be fun, it can be infuriating on the late career level as the difficulty spikes are quite high even on easy difficulty mode.

Also during said late game career the where game becomes annoying difficult especially when you are trying to get a high score to addvance the career mode, you will get wrecked also easier as the AI will often gang up on you dispite the game being a free for all leaving your score to go in to the red.

In the end first impressions are quite good, the music is great and has a beat to it, but as you slowing advance through the career mode all the little issues because the difficulty starts of quite low giving you time to have fun wacky physics, it slowly gets worse as the controls arn't up to tougher challeges the game throws at you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I can't help but love the twisted humour of the blood letting of pedestrians in the original Carmageddon. How can I kill a pedestrian? Let me count the ways....

This reboot of Carmageddon feels true to the original DOS version of many moons lost. It has the same cars, the same  power-ups, the same scale of speed, impact and brute force. It even hs the same epic battles with the pigs, *cough*, I mean... police" as the original. It brings to the table a modern refresh of the original in all it's bloody glory.

It does however fall short of the mark in overall execution and  presentation. The game is nowhere near finished and the so called "trailers" which feature ultra HD
recommended: do not represent in any way what you get in terms of in-game graphics.\n\nShould you care? The game play is solid
hoursPlayed: even if the in-game graphics and content are not. These can be easily ignored if the underlying gameplay is solid
voteText: and it is. Expect graphics on par with Carmageddon 2 Carpocalypse Now @ 20~30 FPS. This game is nowhere near finished. If you can overlook this and are not expecting much past the Max Pack for DOS

From where I am sitting it is a 50/50 call wether they are doing minimal effort to rake in some cash and skip town. Overall recommended for die-hard fans of the series. Otherwise wait until the game is finished (It's been a while).\n\nIn a nutshell - Recommended... just."

reviewText:
Update 1.1

Saw that the game got a large update. NICE.

Right off the bat I saw Framerate sitting at a playable 30 fps and MORE(default reset settingsEVGAgtx960). Except for those time your detonating massive amounts of peds in one giant explosion, or doing massive dmg to an enemy. (which is OK.)  The game is sitting really good, if your ok with what default settings they give you and willing to part with short framerate spikes. Not to sure about maximum settings.

One of the most, and only peeves, is the loading screen. OK i will admit, it went from 1min and 34 sec, down to somewhere between 48 sec - 1 min 23 sec. (mostly pointing to the lower loading time) Was finally able to get a few games, and rather enjoyed it. Dont think Multiplayer will on my radar soon, but I have a feeling if they focused on those loading screens, these skittles will go down like nerds.  At the moment I would love to see one final update with this much quality, but in the mean time, ill reccommend it if you're willing to overlook loading times(reference i52500K SSD setup)

reviewText:
I see that opinions vary. I write this review as a guy who loved the original Carmageddon 1.

My laptop is a bit below of the recommended configuration. I did not try multiplayer yet.

Carmageddon Reincarnation kontras:
- yes, it has some optimization issues but only on certain parts of the environments or sometimes at big crashes when several cars involved; most of the times it is properly playable
- yes, the controlling of the cars have to be get used and could be improved

But:
- it is Carmageddon 1 on drugs
- it has absolutely the original mood
- the new powerup system is excellent (if you learn how to use it)
- cars break like charm
- watching peds to splash is extremely satisfying
- i like the new game modes
- the environments are carefully drawn up and are meticulously designed

All in all: the developers did not want to get away cheaply. The game is worth it despite its defects. May be they will be improved shortly.

I miss the ratcam a bit.

reviewText:
Carma's back, and it's as good as ever.

Brilliant level design, insane vehicles, ridiculous power ups (and power downs) and the series' absolutely ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• sense of humor are all back again in this true sequel to Carpocalypse Now !

Overall it looks like it came straight out of 2006, but Carma's got it where it matters : The car models are superb, and so is the damage rendering, and the gore looks and sounds fantastic.

If you had to play one racing game in your life, it would be Carmageddon.

Original and smart, with a level design modern first person shooters should take lessons from.

reviewText: I've had a lot of fun playing this, it brings me back to the memories of the original Carmageddon so many years ago.  The graphics are updated and seem to run well on my machine.  The music is done well with a mixture of electronic and metal.  If you enjoy smashing up cars, hitting pedestrians, and racing this is a solid game.  The gameplay has a variety of races/battles in career mode.  Kill your opponents to add their car to your stable.  Finding tokens to upgrade your car can be a bit of a drag, but just be on the look out for them.  If your going to pick this up I suggest getting a bundle of the series if you can, otherwise  wait for a sale and grab it up.  Just remember 200 points for grandma with a walker.
voteText: 7 of 13 people (54%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I loved Carmageddon: TDR2000 and thought this game looked absolutely amazing, so, like an idiot I pre-ordered ages ago.

Finally got around to playing it... and wow... erm... It's like playing Carmtageddon TDR2000 if the handling was weightless and pathetic. Not to mention the absolutely atrocious performance... THIS GAME TAKES MORE POWER THAN GTA5 TO RUN!? SERIOUSLY!?!?  On the graphics level I have to run it at (Phenom II X6 1055T 3Ghz, 10GB Ram, GTX 970 4GB) this absolute dog of a game runs at MAXIMUM 30 FPS, with random freezes often and peds that'll appear, disappear, run in circles, not do anything, bounce off the car pointlessly or just glitch out completely and run sideways along the road.

I really wanted to love this game, but I just can't, I wish I could warn my previous self to not get the game but, damn it too late.

TLDR: Bad performance, weightless cars (Kerbs will kill you), unsatisfying splats, god awful sound effects

Edit: 09/2015

Ok well I've downloaded it again, and given it a quick test. I'll say it has improved, the game is now more playable than before.

The handling deffinately needs imrovement though, the cars handle like a bad arcade racer, and the skidding sound gets dreary after a short time.

But, with a little more polish, I think it could be a good game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game isn't out yet, obviously.  But if you enjoyed the original Carmageddon or Carmageddon 2, you will enjoy this one.  Bugs aside, the music is fanastic (I don't like the non-metal tracks but it's easy enough to get around that).  Graphics are fun, a lot of familiar faces in the game, and the maps are great.

I highly recommend it if you enjoyed the original titles.  Just load it up, smash up some cars, run over some people, and relax.  Good fun.

For the record, I have a GTX 780ti and the game runs at 120fps at max settings without any issues.  Here is proof WITH loading screen as well, which didn't take long for me:  https://youtu.be/7FOFJ1i5Mx0

Another thing too...the original was a buggy mess as well and nobody had a problem with it.  So yeah, this game is buggy too.  But it comes with the territory.  There is a enough to appreciate to overlook it, IMO.

reviewText:
So Ladies and Gentlemen, this won't take more than 2 minutes of your time.

I only played Carmageddon 1 back in the day, to see what the fuss was all about. Can't say i became a fan with that.

Bought Carmageddon : Reincarnation 1 month before it's official v.1.0 release, after a friend suggested me this new game.

I LOVE C:R for what it is. A good, fun, wrecking derby with pedestrians and craziness all over.
Never was  a big fan of racing games, but C:R adds so much to the genre.
Crushes are a work of art. Enemies make you laugh. Bonuses and powerups make me laugh like an idiot. Soundtrack is great!

My only complaint is the optimization. I mean i've been gaming since 1993 and i know much of the technical stuff. I can understand that the Crushing code and a physics-heavy Engine is demanding. The graphics on the other hand are NOT outstanding. They're just good. So bottom line : it could have more FPS on the low end.

On my rig (i7-3770k OCed @ 4.6GHz and an AMD 7970) i get 46-85 FPS, with an average of 63FPS. That's steady!
But without overclock it runs at 36-70 FPS.

All in all, pretty good game. I can understand that not all people have my rig and are afraid to overclock, hence the complaint.
Game Recommended EZ. EZ LIFE, EZ CASES , EZ MONEY

KHESIA_SE_OISOPHAGO out. Gonna take my GF to a good restaurant! bb

reviewText: While I love that they are attempting to bring back a classic. I just feel that this game is a little hollow and seemingly unfinished. Enjoyable at times but extremly frustrating at others. I especially despise that damage models and the way the AI attacks at times. I can slam ED 101's Toshiba into a wall at top speeds and then hit em with 1-2 slaughter mortars and there he is just spinning around happy as a clam. I get smashed into a wall at half speed in a fully armor upgraded (insert vehicle here) and boom WRECKED. Still fun but I feel I can only do a race or two at a time before I'm done for the day\n3 OUTTA 5 TOPS, get it on sale and enjoy a little nostalgia

reviewText:
The way Carmageddon is presented and the way that the press have used it as ammunition for their ‚Äòviolence in video games‚Äô arguments you‚Äôd be forgiven for thinking that the most notable feature of any game within the Carmageddon franchise is it‚Äôs gore but it really isn‚Äôt, yes Carmageddon is a gory and politically incorrect game that rewards you for mowing down (assumed) innocent people but just portraying the games in the franchise as such would be doing them a great disservice, each Carmageddon game (ignoring console ports and that incident in 2000) has pushed the boundaries when it comes to video game technologies with realistic damage physics that actually react to collisions and stunningly complex environments that have pushed the tech of the time to it‚Äôs limits and Carmageddon: Reincarnation is no different.

The game itself is a reboot of the franchise and a re-imagining of the first Carmageddon, bringing fan favourite characters, vehicles and levels from the first game back for another outing but don‚Äôt go thinking Carmageddon: Reincarnation is just a fresh coat of paint on the old Carmageddon formula, Stainless Games have mixed up the old with the new adding in various new and interesting features that make this the most accessible Carmageddon game to date.

In previous Carmageddon games you were thrown into a level and left to do as you please, you could win the events in one of three ways:
1. Completing the race- Never encouraged and you were barely rewarded for doing so, races would tend to prove more costly racing than anything
2. Mowing down all of the pedestrians- Which takes great exploration, patience and skill and you‚Äôre rewarded well for doing it and
3. Destroying all of your opponents- The most favourite and most common method of winning a Carmageddon event

In Reincarnation this has come to be known as the ‚ÄòClassic Carma‚Äô event but Reincarnation adds a lot of other events into the mix such as Checkpoint Stampede which involves players racing to as many checkpoints as possible before the rest of their opponents, Ped Stampede which is the same as Checkpoint Stampede but you‚Äôre racing to mow down specific pedestrians before your opponents, Car Crusher which is a demolition derby style mode where the only way to win is to wreck your opponents and Death Race which is just a race.

Now whilst I‚Äôm all for innovation especially with older games, Carmageddon was always about being able to win the game how you want to win it and when you‚Äôre being presented with an event where the only way to win is to actually race it feels not only like the whole ‚Äòantidote to racing games‚Äô and touting Carmageddon as an anti-racing game is actually a lie but it also doesn‚Äôt feel like Carmageddon, even though Stainless Games have to their credit tried to give the players additional unique ways to beat these events, for example in a Death Race event you can waste other opponents and steal their laps instead of actually racing, these gamemodes still feel like a shoe-horned in effort to present a wider variety of content without actually providing new content. I was always fine with these events being solely-multiplayer modes as they used to be in the previous games, presenting them as actual gamemodes feels the same as Quake III Arena‚Äôs singleplayer mode, it‚Äôs just multiplayer but with (AI) bots.

Whilst I‚Äôm on the subject of content I must mention that Carmageddon: Reincarnation doesn‚Äôt have as much as other games in the franchise, whilst it does offer more than enough content to keep you happy the game does feel like it‚Äôs prolonging your experience by recycling the same levels a lot, this feels especially true in the career mode where you‚Äôre given 16 tiers of events to complete and within these tiers is around 3-4 different races, each one of these races is a different gamemode, the first one being Classic Carma and the remaining events being a mixture of the new stuff, now the game has only a handful of environments so it throws a lot of events at you and a lot of these are within the same environments just with different track layouts but one positive thing is that the game doesn‚Äôt force you to complete every single event as each tier is unlocked by accruing a certain amount of credits within the previous tier, so if you hated Death Race and only wanted to play Classic Carma (like me) then you can just replay Classic Carma events to get enough credits to unlock the next tier, which is a nice compromise.

I‚Äôve made it clear that I don‚Äôt like how few environments we‚Äôre presented with in the game but what we are given is insanely detailed and every level has plenty of things that you can do, be it collecting Smelly Bushes (yes, you read that right), finding ‚Äòcash cows‚Äô or just exploring little side areas and interiors, a lot of work has been put into fleshing out each of these environments and giving them life and they really do feel great with thousands of different accessories just sitting about waiting to be destroyed, you really feel like you‚Äôre causing havoc in a living world. Stainless Games have also confirmed that they will be adding another environment to the game in a future update, which is nice of them and should alleviate the repetition.

Complaints aside Carmageddon: Reincarnation is a stunning game and really takes the franchise into the modern day gaming world, the most impressive aspects of the game are the vehicles, they‚Äôre intricately detailed each with their own personality, they‚Äôre donned with blades, spikes and all manner of ped-maiming weaponry, every vehicle has it‚Äôs own modelled suspension that buckles if you push it too hard, the vehicles crumple and deform to where they‚Äôre hit and tyres deflate and come loose from rims just as if you were plowing real cars into each other and all of this happens without the game dropping a single frame, it really is an impressive sight to see!

Now I‚Äôd like to address the performance of the game, I am running an i5-2500, 8GB RAM and an NVidia GTX 560 (1GB VRAM) my system is around 4 years old, so it‚Äôs getting on a bit but Carmageddon: Reincarnation will run on mostly High settings with a few of the major ones on Medium at my full screen resolution of 1680X1050 without issue, it doesn‚Äôt run at a constant 60fps and tends to stick between the 40-50 mark though it rarely ever drops below 30 which for a game as complex as this is quite astounding.

The game boasts a wide variety of different graphics options so you‚Äôre able to tweak the game to your liking to get the best experience possible out of it but because it streams in virtual textures as you‚Äôre playing you cannot really adjust texture quality to your liking as this happens automatically based on the amount of VRAM you have available, so you should take this into account when playing as it needs a lot of horsepower in not only your GPU but also your CPU and hard drive to get the best out of it but with that being said it will run just fine on a mid-range system, load times are on average 45 seconds for me which is also fairly impressive given the amount of assets that the game loads in initially.

In pre-alpha and alpha I couldn‚Äôt even get the game running at anything other than sub-5fps but Stainless have really polished their baby and added a lot of love, care and attention to turn it into what it is today and that‚Äôs quite possibly the most-fun (anti) racing game on the market, filled to the brim with humour, gore, crazy powerups, impressive tech and most important of all fun and for pure enjoyment alone I would highly recommend another romp in the Carmageddon universe with Carmageddon: Reincarnation.

Don‚Äôt forget that mods are already starting to roll out for the game and when the Carmageddon community gets into it‚Äôs stride with modding nothing can stop us, the game will continue to stay fresh for many years due to mod support.

reviewText:
Finally it is out! I was always a fan of Carma since the 2nd Carma was the best last. I used to play that game for hours because the maps were fun and it just kind of sucks you in. This one sets the bar so much better. I hope they will release a 4th. They better!
I read the reviews prior to purchasing this but pulled the trigger regardless as Carma is just too fun not to have and am i glad i did!
Here is what I liked:

REPLAY FACTOR- Insane replay factor. You can literally play this game a million ways and always find ways to entertain yourself. I am never uninstalling this and would love an actual physical copy (more of a nostalgia thing from the original )

LEVELS-The levels are enormous so much exploration here, I can see myself spending countless hours on each map going to new places and driving around.

CARS-the car models are awesome

DAMAGE- damage physics are amazing. No GTA game has anywhere near awesome damage physics for cars, the deformations and impact is very cool almost has a close NGBeam game engine style for damage. To me, car physics are a big deal, If the damage doesnt look convincing then whats the point of crashing. I never found GTA to be good at physics, they should learn from Carmageddon.

POWERUPS- Very creative and fun power ups allow you to do so much damage it never gets old

GORE- The gore on this is awesome, i love how they expanded on the gore and made it so much more fun

GRAPHICS- Sure its not Project Cars pretty or GTA budget but from where it came originally this is good enough!!!! Dont expect it to be life like, it is not meant to be, maybe in the future they will, that would be nice! Relax and enjoy it!

NEEDED IMPROVEMENTS-

Overall this is a keeper 100%, but as of its initial release on 5/21 the game does need to be updated ASAP at least in the following areas.

-OPTIMIZE THIS ENGINE NOW- By today's standards and the price we pay for having high end rigs, the frame rate should not run the way it does on PC's. Unless you are playing on a very old graphics card then its one story, but for most part a game like this even for PS3/PS4 is expected to run a steady 60FPS, and so should our computers. Cannot run this @ 60 with max settings which it must. Dont pull an Arma3 move and leave everyone trying to figure out whats wrong with their computers when the engine is busted no-one wants to play below 60 FPS today. Stainless knows this already from our comments, i just hope they are doing everything they can. We want to see 60 FPS min

-DOWNLOADABLE CONTENT-
Eventually would be pretty good idea to release DLC content which includes new vehicles, maps , Power Ups

-GAME UPDATES-
As many as possible here. The more the merrier.

So after all of the positives and the negatives, by all means buy this game but DO NOT change your Graphics settings to any other level other than stock and you will be fine until they release an update.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Wow, finally a remake done right...  It's the good old Carmag experience actualised for today gaming...

Can't wait for career mode, having a sense of progression add a lot of value to the game, It's fun to just Freeplay any stage but having everything of the bat shorten the time I will spend on that game.

you get about everything the good old carmageddon had (the 1st at least wasn't a fan of the direction taken in the 2nd..)
but with a lot more polish

They had cool things to the game like dynamic stages( got crushed under a container being moved by some kind of bridge lift 10/10)
If you drive into smaller object they will act like if you actually would have hit them (yeah we have physics now in 2014 ^^)
The best of all your car doesn't looks like a huge pixelated turd!

I was so sceptic about buying that one being deceived by so many remake lately.. well way to go guys hading stuff whitout removing the core game is what I expect from a remake.. there were reason to begin with why we loved that games and those reasons are still in there but with a nice and refreshing overhaul, even sounds effects are familliar and the music was what I was expecting, metal is important while ramming pedestrian and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•^^

2nd thing I was a bit concerned about is early acces... got some bad experiences with lots of those^^...
Well the game is very playable as it is, and its current states would enjoy it more than a couple of early I got some of them are even finished and were a bad guess from me since they are as fun as getting ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• by godzilla^^
That said, yes there is still a lot of work to do, optimisation and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• but I consider it already like a good gaming investement the game is great and the gameplay is awesome.

Highly recommand to anyone who ever enjoyed the 1st

reviewText:
A fun game with a few issues,

Lets start with the bad since thats all people focus on,
CR has a few glitches, bugs, none of them are really game braking, but sometimes youll encounter slight bugs like pedestrians not being fully on the ground, and random smoke from some areas of the ground, The biggest issue tho seems to be the proformance, It can be a little low on the FPS, and stutters on occasion, But atleast for me it seems to run fine Most of the time,

The good, Its a great, adicitive, and enjoyable game, For the first time carmageddon also has working multiplayer, The game seems stable with no crashes since Alpha stages, Much better proformance (for me personally) than alpha too, All in All this is a great and fun game to play thru if you can over look slightly dated graphics and are not addicted to games that Only play at 60 fps, Seriusly :P Forget about perfect frames per second for a moment and enjoy yourself, This game delivers what a lot of games forget to now An enjoable experiance,

reviewText:
Fun game, but not perfect.  I think that Carmageddon 1 and 2 brought much more for their time in the 90s than this game does now.

Pros:
-Looks good,
-Cool effects (e.g. parts flying back to the car as it is repaired),
-Decent crash physics,
-Simple fun, and
-Runs smooth on a i5 2500 & GTX 970 machine at a 2560 x 1440 resolution on max settings minus antialiasing (~50 FPS).  Antialiasing drops the FPS down to ~42 FPS, which is still smooth.

Cons:
-No standalone multiplayer servers - have to wait for someone to host a game, or become a host and wait a considerable amount of time... recommend playing with friends,
-All cars appear to be AWD (all wheel drive).. constantly spinning all 4 wheels in most situations (this bothers me quite a bit),
-I realize that this isn't a simulator, but expected more out of driving physics 20 years later, and
-Expected more overall from the game besides visual updates over Carma 1 & 2.  It feels like a mix of Carma 1 & 2, without anything new really.. and those are old games.

Bought the game at 50%-off sale price.  Game appears to be interesting/addicting enough for me to keep playing through it, but I still would not have bought it at a full price of around $25 or 25‚Ç¨.

Carmageddon was a massive PC game for me when I was a kid. Though it was probably WAAYYYY inappropriate for an 8 year old
date:
my parents were great and allowed me to experience things young knowing that I wasn't going to grow up to be a mass pedestrian killer or badass alien slayer (Duke Nukem was a big game for me at this time as well)

Me and my friends would have riotous fun playing Carmageddon and Carmageddon 2 way back when on old crappy Packard Bell (WHO!?) PC's. Those games are highly nostalgic and I have very fond memories looking back.

reviewText:
I would not recommend this game.

It's not a bad game per se, but it still definitely lacks some freshness.

First off, the game does not run smooth. I'm pretty sure if you had heavy machinery this would not be an issue, still, i have a decent configuration and the game is neither pretty nor fluid, so basically, there's just something wrong there.

Secondly, for those who played the first opus, there's not much to say about the new one. Apart from a graphical update (lacking as i was saying), there's no real innovation, same cars, same tracks, well, it's pretty much the same game.

The bonuses are fun, but most of them are pretty useless, the physics model is sometimes pretty strange, and the game as a whole is somewhat repetitive.

reviewText:
Released 2 (or is it 3 now?) years late, this game fails dismally to deliver.

It's plagued by performance problems seemingly endemic to the engine and doesn't even look pretty as payoff. The engine can't even handle LOD'ing properly! Even the much shouted-about physics aren't anything of note; easily surpassed as they were before release by competitors. On top of this the 10GB download is a joke for the paucity of content the title delivers.

As for gameplay - it's boring and dated. No effort has been made to bring the series in-line with the expectations of modern gamers. It'll fail to keep anyone but the most slavish fan interested for more than ~30 minutes. The 'humor' is passe, so try-hard that it fails to come across as anything other than tiresome shlock.

It seems like developers Stainless have drunk deeply from the cup of hubris and this cold weak dribble of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• was all they managed to expel as a result. Avoid.

reviewText:
#Updated Review 4 September 2015

3 months after the release a 'suprise 2.5GB patch' arrived, which finally made the game playable. I get 80 more FPS compared to the previous versions. So it turned out nothing is impossible, and the developers tried to fix the serious performance issues. Even most of the players thought the game won't be fixed, and they just took our money. Thank you for your work

It is sad that often, because of the deadlines, you don't have time to release a fully functional game. I know 'business' .... The game got a lot of negative reviews, but with this update I can change mine to a POSITIVE one.

Next time release the game 3 months later, it is better to wait a few months than play with a poorly optimised game, and uninstall it after 30 minutes.


#Old Review  5 June 2015

Still better optimized than Assassin's Creed Unity - Oh wait ! NOT !

I have to update my review and give this game a NEGATIVE. I put my trust in the developer team fix the serious frame rate issues which we experienced during the BETA. But the final update brought no solution, this game has a terrible optimization and it makes the gameplay unenjoyable.

I am very disappointed, and it seems it won't be fixed !

Pros:

Cons:

- You can have a breakfast during the loading screen...

reviewText:
I was a die-hard (ho ho) Carma 1 fan (thousands of hours), and the fun is still here for me in Reincarnation, alas, a few things that stop me playing for anymore than 20 minutes at a time:

1) The car physics are attrocious; it's next to impossible to handle the car unless you come to a near halt to make turns. If you try to handbrake turn, you just spin out for about 10 seconds. It's ridiculous. The cars are also made of tissue paper; all it takes is to get hit from behind or the side and you're wrecked. Meanwhile, you pull the same move on an opponent, and they limp away, or better yet, the physics engine makes you start doing doughnuts at high speed, or hit a curb and be catapulted 100 feet into the air for a mile down the road, before you can hit them.

2) The game modes. Classic Carma or bust. The new game modes stink. That random checkpoint spawn mode is just that -- random. By the time the next one spawns, and you can even turn around to pursue it, it's gone. What makes it even more infurating is the maps; that refinery map is a tight little maze in which it's impossible to maneuver because of the vehicle physics above. You try to turn your car, but you just go into a doughnut spiral for 10 seconds and end up driving into the ocean or something. It's a joke.

These issues fixed, yes, I think Reincarnation would be a lot of fun, but it's just infurating to play like this. It'd be nice to see the original Max Pack vehicles make an appearance, also (Mother Trucker). Anyway, until these issues are fixed, it's a thumbs down for me.

Aside, the soundtrack is top notch, yet again, so I've got to hand it to Stainless for that. Is it possible to get the soundtrack somewhere? (I have Fear Factory's albums, but not the instrumentals -- would be great to get my hands on them)

reviewText:
I wrote a review when this game was in very early access: to summarise, the performance was terrible, the vehicles handle like crap, and there's not much here above the original games which were fantastic for their time.

On release, the performance is terrible, the vehicles handle like crap, and there's still not much 'new' content: but at least this appears to be the accepted consensus. Unfortunately, Stainless Games have shown a complete unwillingness to accept this and have taken the game out of early access anyway.

It could have, and maybe still could be, a decent nod to the original. But there is still a lot of work and I doubt Stainless are going to do it.

reviewText: After making long line of smart" game purchases (like: Brothers
date: This war of mine and Stanley parable) I decided it was time to buy a stupid game... And oh boy

reviewText: Good visuals, great carnage, some fun laughs here and there, big maps, and interesting powerups are absolutely destroyed by the poor controls in this game.  Why does it seem like you're constantly driving on ice?  There's literally no need for the handbrake button because it's almost as if you're always pressing it.  I understand that at high speeds there should be some loss of control, but there's no control at all here.  That's not good, especially during racing segments that require some level of turning capability.  I want to take a soft left, not tailspin into a wall.  The mechanics of this game are borked - if the developers fix them I'll gladly play what seems to be an otherwise great game.

reviewText:
I've been reading the comments for a bit and it's honestly just hilarious.

The game's good, it's a product of a dying genre that had to be financially fueled by fans like me who grew up playing this sort of stuff. It's got the Carma spirit with nice little additions, runs smoothly for all the sprites and models that have to constantly get crushagged and fly around.

The comments are, as always, flooded with butthurt 10 year-olds but here's the sitch. It runs smooth, and way better than I could've expected. If you have problems running it, you probably overestimate your machine's abilities. Mess with the settings for an optimal quality:performance ratio.

Can it be improved? Of course. In the future I'd like to have the chance to make my own cars, but I'm also going to try and mod that in myself, since it comes with the ability to easily mod.


In short; if you grew up with Carma, like I did, you'll like this game. If not, but you still want a game to pass time with, buy it. It's got everything you'd want from a Carma game. And the models and characters look really well polished.

reviewText:
I remember playing Carmagedon years and years ago and loving every minute of it. After booting this game up and playing for a few hours, the nostalgia wore off quickly. The handling of the vehicles is abyssmal. Your vehicle literally goes careening out of control as soon as you hit the smallest piece of debris. The controls are also a horrible. I used a gamepad and I had to select from 3 present control types, all which sucked donkey balls. The input keys for the gamepad cannot be customized, which leads to high levels of frustration when you're caught in a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•torm and you press the wrong ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing button.

The overall mechanics of the game aren't laid out that well either. The weapon selection is a pain in the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• and the weapons themselves are explained very well. It's more of a trial and error. Not to mention, the hit detection to pick up powerups is a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing joke.

After all the years of reminiscing about this game, I was severely disappointed by this steaming pile of dogshit.

reviewText:
I loved old Carmageddon, and I'm happy to no longer fight with DosBox to get it to work. That's the bottom line. But I put it on the top. So you might read it.

It doesn't take much playing to understand exactly what the developers were going for with this one. This is the original Carmageddon redone. From the insane characters, to the insane-er power ups, to the insane-er-er driving physics, it feels like its predecessor. It even threw some Fear Factory back into the soundtrack. Just like old times.

Load times are lengthy, but there's a lot to load. The levels are enormous, and just like any other fine strategy game of its caliber, it can't draw as you go.

Overall, it's a sloppy mess. But it's a fun sloppy mess.

reviewText:
I really wanted to love this game. I was a huge fan of the original. I bought it on PC back in the day, even bought it on mobile when that was released. But...

This is the epitome of putting lipstick on a pig. The car handling is atrocius to the point of being a dealbreaker for me. Don't get me wrong, the fun of this is to crash and blow crap up, but it's like random events, no control. Try turning any car and you're in skid city. Emphasis on physics and sometimes you tap an object and you're wrecked. I'd run over pedestrians but see the previous part about every car steering like a greased 3 ton pig. And braking or speed to control your car? Forget it. It's like no one on the dev team ever drove a car.. ever.

I guess i'll put this away... again... for a few months and see if they patch it... again... to make it playable. Performance issues did go away, but now it just left a spotlight on the design flaws that I was hoping were related to lagged input to the poor performing engine.

It looks great and would have fun crashes if the physics/steering issues were addressed. I still think the load times are a bit excessive on a machine with an i7, 16gb ram, and sammie 850 pro SSD. I can't imagine how long load times take on lower spec machines.

Really regret doing Early Access for this and I'm writing this review only after putting in time with the finished product months after release. Just play the old game. At least you can chalk stupid crap up to the game being old.

reviewText: Don't get me wrong, the game by itself is a great enjoyable reincarnation of good old Carmageddon games. Real fun to play, with lots of promising stuff yet planned to be released in the future. The devs show great dedication to this game and their fans and I do believe they honestly care for it, which is great. I really like this game, as far as gameplay goes.\n\nWhy can't I recommend it at its current state then? Well, it's purely from the technical standpoint. Despite devs already making a great progress in optimization since it came out (which shows that they do indeed care), it still needs quite a bit of performance fixes. Inconsistent unstable FPS that flies all over the place and wildly ranges from sometimes as little as 20 to as high as 90 greatly diminish the overall impression and experience (and this is disregarding of the settings I'm playing on). Most of the time it stays reasonably high (50+), but the experience-killing FPS dips are indeed very, very frequent (and, because the game is generally" at 50+
