reviewText:
Just dumb. Very, very dumb. Its not hard because of interesting AI, or level design, or even because things get chaotic... Its hard because the cars are impossible to steer. I'm not expecting a race simluator, but if I have a 3 ton vehicle driving on concrete it shouldn't handle like its on ice. And all of the vehicles handle like they're on ice the entire time.

What made the original game fun was being able to reach high speeds, take amazing corners and stratagise amazing ways to take out your opponent. The only thing you will do in this game over and over again is try and keep your car in a straight line, brake long before you need to turn, almost to a complete stop, and then you can turn. But then don't accelerate too much too soon or you'll just end up spinning around. And don't bother trying to correct either, or you'll just end up fishtailing.

Honestly don't buy this one. Go back and get the earlier ones if you're interested.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok....  This is an Early Access game and boy does it show!  It's limited by the choice of vehicles, courses and lack of mulitplayer, but all those things are progressing and following the Livestreams shows new content being added all the time.  Apart from the livestream builds being crazily unstable!

But all that aside, it is Carmageddon!  Both in terms of gameplay, comedy and style.  It looks amazing even in the Early Access builds, the gore is correctly over the top, the cars manoevre and bend just so and the entire thing has more content than some finished products even now.  Is it earth shattering?  Right now, probably not, but then we have not tried the Multiplayer or any other final content.  This is stripped back and barebones for a Carma title.

If you have ever loved Carmageddon, this is the modern and worthy successor and an essential addition to the series, but if you have never tried Carma in the past, is it worth it then?  Well,  as it is, it would probably take some persuasion to make a new player commit, but I think it is an experience that every gamer has to try at least once....  You have to remember that the earlier incarnations of Carmageddon caused media backlashes as the series was running down peeps in third / first person when GTA was still an overhead view.

That's what I couldn't place!  As a player of the original Carma's 1, Splat Pack, 2 and TDR2000, it's quaint!  But that's not a bad thing at all.  The feeling of tradition in Reincarnation is there.  This game will carry on the tradiition of Carma, sticking up two fingers to the man and letting grimy racing games continue!  In a way, I hope the media rises up in another backlash as development continues, since it'll only bring the game more spotlight.

Just one word of warning, the builds are horribly unoptimised, so check your rig before you buy, it needs to be beefy to run it smoothly right now, but the specs should become more reasonable as the alpha build we currently have progresses into more of a beta state, but don't hold your breath, since Stainless has commited to a 'few update builds' model for Early Access.  It is understandable since they are a small team and have little time to step aside from the main coding to produce smaller 'Release Alpha / Beta Builds'.  They tie up too much time and work hours in the team.  Although they have promised 'Milestone Builds' to help advertise major new features (MP should be a Milestone Build), as well as allow the players a chance to bug test and stress their work a little.

So, yes, get Reincarnation....  The new bonuses of the earlier games are nice, but it doesn't distract from what should be a spectacular main event.  Long live the comedy, gore and car bending!

reviewText:
This game is fun. It's just like the old Caramgeddon game. Wrecking opponents, running over countless of hapless pedestrians etc. I love it, it really feels like Carmageddon.

What I don't like is the performance problems, Sure, this game does simulate a lot of stuff, and I mean A LOT OF STUFF. Parts of cars stay in the game world and have physics, much of the world is both destructible and have physics etc. It is very ambitious that way. Very. Still I get 60+ FPS on the lowest settings no problem. On highest it dips down to around 40 at worst. Really no bigge for this type of game. Biggest complaint would be the level loading times. A minute or two feels a bit long today. Yet there is a lot of stuff in the levels. Tons of hidden stuff, don't be afraid to go off the beaten path.

I recommend this game, it loads of fun.

reviewText:
I wanted to like this game.  I wanted to LOVE this game.  But, for the time being, I have to say 'no' to recommending it.

Don't get me wrong, it's a new Carmageddon game.  It just doesn't quite have the same feel to it - your car feels weaker in this than previous games, though they did have the same 'sloppy' handling feel to them.  There's a lot of things they got right in this one.  The time ticks up quickly enough to give you a chance to explore, but you do need to be wary of it early on.  Unlike the third game with the hard 5 minute cap that prevented real exploration.  A lot of the classic cars are back.  The game play, the power ups, the cops.  All the elements are there to make this a good nostalgic game.

But there are bugs.  Lots of bugs.  Bugs that I didn't mind during Early Access, because the game was still being worked on then.  But we're not in Early Access anymore.  We've even had a couple major updates since then.  And some of the bugs persist.  Bugs such as some car skins not unlocking when they're supposed to.  Challenges and Achievements not properly tracking.  There's even instances where your car can get wrecked several times in a row, causing you to lose big on events where points are deducted for wrecks.  (Worst case I've had, one wreck cost me six points, because I got wrecked, was instantly wrecked again when I hit the ground (was mid air), got wrecked again while being teleported away and hit the ground, wrecked again when spawned, once more as the car that hit me the first time hit me again while my car was still 'weakened' trying to repair itself, and a final time spawning and hitting the ground again.)  There's a lot of times when the AI goes out of its way to harass you, the player, in career mode - even when the event calls for different objectives.  (Such as Fox N' Hound, when the AI will constantly try to run into you even if you're not the fox.)  I've also had instances in races where all five of the opponents, in the first two minutes of the match, decided to ignore everything and just try to wreck me over and over.

There are some interesting touches, but the game doesn't do a good job telling you about them.  For example, to upgrade, you MUST collect upgrade tokens.  What the game doesn't tell you is that these are spawned randomly, based on how badly the car you are currently in needs them.  I had completed half the campaign mode in just the Eagle because I didn't have enough points to fully upgrade it yet, let alone have enough to begin upgrading any other car.  Eventually I decided to give the Degoryun a chance anyway.  I picked up 36 upgrade tokens in one race, enough to fully upgrade three cars.  So, yea, use the other vehicles it gives you.

Another new feature, which lead to one of the big bugs above I talked about, is that when your car is damaged, repairing it just pulls the missing pieces to your car.  And your care will remain in the weakened state until those parts arrive.  And sometimes, particularly if you've been pushed around a lot, it can take a while for those parts to arrive.  Long enough to be wrecked several times while waiting for it.

The controller support is a bit questionable as well.  It claims you can do a wheel spin by double tapping the throttle.  But that has never worked for me.  (Keyboard has a nice button that acts as that.)  Plus, you can't set the controller however you like, only set it based on a few pre-selected layouts.  There's also a problem where the camera options are reset with every different car, meaning I am placed FAR too close to my vehicle every time I switch.

Other bugs include not properly marking which map the remaining hidden items are on (not that I've had much luck finding ANY marking of where the hidden items are).  Pedestrians floating in mid air.  If you're on a checkpoint in checkpoint race when it spawns you have to leave it and come back in (yes, I call this a bug, it shouldn't spawn on top of people anyway).  Having the graphics of the level flicker in and out of existence.  Having the UI get stuck so it doesn't properly display what power up is selected.  Etc. Etc.

As stated, this game is fully released now.  But there are things missing.  It has at least been fairly optimized finally (though some people claim the most recent patch made it worse again for them).  There's a decent amount to do.. when it works.  But in this state?  No, I can't recommend it.  Maybe once all of these bugs are fixed (and, no, things like achievements not properly tracking or unlocking what they're supposed to unlock are not 'too minor to worry about', what they ARE is an indication of laziness that a simple bug has never been fixed) then I can revisit this review, and give this game the recommendation it should deserve.  But until then, no.  It may be Carmageddon, but it's a mess.

reviewText: As a person who does this myself, it still needs to be said, good intentions gets you nowhere without follow up to it, and sadly this game while possibly filling a underserved niche, it fell rather flat on it's face straight from thet get go of the BETA and seemingly never recovered. Checked back a bunch of months later to see if they had done any updates/posts to the game since release, not a single thing, given this game will need multiplayer to survive, combine that with the poor optimization and the seemingly lack of any future content, this game is dead on arrival, only fair recomendation to the average consumer is.. DO NOT BUY. You can getter more and better games for your money during a Steam sale than this.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TLDR - proper remake, done well, should be fab when finished.
FINALLY! For about 10 years I have periodically tried to install and run Carmageddon again, and failed. I also always wondered why nobody was redoing it, with nothing like it's career mode on any other game I tried.
So I was chuffed to spot it doing the crowdfunding rounds a year or so back. And now it's working on steam at last.
Review (Oct 2014) - the fundamentals are all there now. Drive about, run stuff over, wreck each other. The humour is the same schoolboy crude silliness, and the zombies of my youth are now pedestrians. Bugs, glitches various ofc, but it's not finished. Looks like mostly needs content finishing and few tweaks to complete.
March 2015 - beta, all is working, few odd bugs still, occasional crash, but mostly works well. Apparently full career mode working, I'm losing lots of hours when too tired to play serious games.
So yes probably worth ¬£20 for the game, but defo worth it with the original and 2 thrown in and working on steam too.

reviewText:
Update: stage 1 optimization complete! The game has improved performance, raising framerate to the Max!


Oldschool Carmageddon gameplay with more modern graphics! It's a race to the finish line, but who the hell wants to do that when you can just kill the other racers? Wreck all of your opponents until you're the last car standing, or kill all the pedestrians with your monster truck with a thrusting drill attached to the hood. good times. Fun power ups with names like  mine $#!++3r that lets your car crapt mines for your opponents to eat, or temporary rapture, that raises peds to heaven with angel choir singing, only to have them brutally slammed back to earth a few seconds later. Brutal car slamming combat, with realistic damage models, that can be repaired mid race, like a time machine magnet, sending metal shrapnel back to your car, decapitating peds that happen to be between you and that rear axel you lost half way across the track. Replay the violent metal and blood blood bath on the fly with the powerful replay editor! Plus you can flap your car doors, to smash pedestrians as you speed by.

reviewText:
It really does say it all in the name: SCI zapped the corpse of a long-dead game, added some parts, and created a whole new monster. This is the highly-anticipated successor to Carmageddon 2, which was full of car-smashy, pedestrian-squishy goodness, with some racing thrown in to completely break the flow and punish you dearly.

However, this time around, things work differently. Now to advance to the next group of events, you merely have to amass a certain amount of credits, which are otherwise worthless, unless you care about leaderboards. Now, upgrade tokens are hidden throughout each level that enable you to upgrade each car's toughness, offense, and speed. New event types were added to spice things up a bit, though the end result is much the same, you can easily win by smashing everyone up if you like.

The handling oscillates between arcadey and strangely realistic (read - impossible) which is a bit surprising because being careful is the last thing I want to do in this game, but it is still an improvement from eighteen years ago. You either are driving a car with sticky tires or no tires at all. Things work very well with a 360 gamepad, better than expected, but keyboard works just as well.

There are bugs and glitches, it will hitch up and/or crash to desktop on rare occasions, and the loading times are very long considering everything is being loaded from the hard drive. Supposedly the graphics aren't that good either, but to be honest, I haven't noticed, because I'm too busy having fun. You know, the point of a video game?

Thankfully, the essence of the original game is still present here. Still present are those moments when you've knocked off most of the other cars and just tool around the expansive maps doing as you please with an overabundance of weapons and power-ups (seriously there are way too many and it's a problem,) coupled with the mayhem of an entire group of cars are trying desperately to turn you into hamburger, and just the general absurdity of tossing cars around like paper mache effigies.

You'll live, you'll die, you'll live again. But instead of going to Valhalla, you just smash more cars.

For all its foibles, it's still lovable, and in my opinion, better than the reviews indicate.

reviewText: First off, this game could be so much more than it is. I have played every version of the carma series and the lack of more creativity in this game is very disapointing. The same old power ups mainly from the carma's before. The cars , the physics are ok, I prefer the faster more controllable driving of the tdr series. The maps are typical carma, nothing new or inventive really. Where is the on track catapult???, or speed boost arrows?, or the occasional nuke maybe? C'mon man , have some vision. The game is still pretty buggy. It just crashed on me at close to 200k of bonus, very irritating.\nThe game is fun, but I am still very irritated at the lack of vision and creativity. The boring cliche lines of dialogue are terrible, along with the music. No in game music player option either. Lame.

reviewText:
Fun game. Still runs like crap even after the performance patch.

Game is fun and the damage model is insanely detailed but even after turning some of the settings down it still struggles to maintain 60 FPS. Additionally the refresh rate and v-sync options don't work for me. Setting the refresh to 60 Hz did not change it from my 144 Hz desktop refresh and it still tore frames with v-sync on. I had to force adaptive v-sync in the NVIDIA control panel and I have to change my desktop refresh rate prior to launching the game to minimize tearing and get it to run at a somewhat stable frame rate. GTA V runs at a rock solid 60 FPS with all the regular settings maxed except for grass detail (most of the advanced settings maxed too) and 2x MSAA. The graphics in this games are about 5-7 years out of date so there's no reason for it to run so poorly. Recommended but only just. If they can fully otimize thier engine I could recommend it without hesitation. For reference I'm running a i7-4770k @ 4.4 GHz, 8 GB 1866 MHz DDR3, EVGA GTX 970 SSC with +100 MHz core clock and +500 MHz memory clock (1 GHz effective).

6.5/10 (8.5 if they can get it to run decent)

reviewText:
Love the game!!! I always enjoyed the Carmageddon games since back when the very first Carmageddon was released.
I had a 1990's PCwith a Cyrix Chip, 28mb memory and a Voodoo card that had only 8mb memory. Think it was in 97 when i played the DEMO for the very first time. I was in middle school at the time and was the craziest game I ever seen.

CONS: I hope there will be updates soon to help out with load times and stutters when grappics are set on high.

I built a very powerful rig with a 290X 4GB graphics card and 32GB of memory But still when I have the settings on max the game runs like garbage.

The best settings for me is on a balance. My friend and I played a game online together and it seem to run decent with little stutter issiues.

Please but a little more into this game and work out the bugs. I was so happy when i seen they released a new version.

date:
this reboot(?) is exactly what I hoped for.

It's the perfect marriage of all the parts of Carma 1 and 2 that I most liked.

+ the classic levels are here
+ car handling is perfect (feels just like Carma 1 which in my book is a good thing)
+ heaps of rooftop jumping antics
+ peds are easier to hit and more satsfying than they were in Carma 2
+ cunning stunts!
+ all the classic and super-‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• powerups are here

- feels a bit sluggish on my mid-range PC
- the mechanic for flipping your car back over only seems to work half the time
- engine sound is a bit pathetic
- I'm reaching here
recommended: there's really not a lot to complain about!"

reviewText:
I so very hard want to like this game, because I loved playing Carmageddons 1 and 2 as a kid, and this looks to have exactly the sort of gameplay I want of a Carma remake. That's also the reason why I originally helped kickstart this game.

However, despite the supposed optimizations this game has received since launching initially, my performance is still atrocious even on the lowest settings I can muster. Sure, my machine isn't amazing but it can run Star Citizen at a decent framerate for pete's sake. It should be able to run a game of this visual quality at more than 15 FPS. I can't really play the game in an enjoyable manner at these sorts of framerates. I so very much wish I could.

Also, on a lesser note, I noticed that there's no joystick support in this game. What's up with that?

reviewText: I waited so long for this, starting with the beta versions which were full of promise if you could play more than a minute without a lockup. Now fhe complete game is out I'm struggling to see why I wanted it so much. It's good looking enough, with pretty destruction and camera effects. Yes the concept is still the same that I lost my childhood to but the first few races have been irritating more than fun.\nTricky handling, opponenents who waste you against walls EVERY time you get stuck for even a second, and who are unbearably good at making checkpoints and winning races, even with wheels missing.  Speaking of which, the events so far are much too biased towards racing or winning checkpoints, such that there's no time to be enjoying any of the fun stuff like powerups, collecting upgrades, exploring, doing stunts etc. I am averagely good at these sort of games but I found myself repeatedly restarting races just because I'd flipped over or hit a wall, because I knew there was no hope of winning and therefore progressing. I'm going to stick with it and see if things improve with some new cars and upgrades but so far, it's scream at monitor-restart-get wasted-curse-restart-get stuck, opponents get checkpoints-restart etc... Tell me if I'm doing this wrong!

reviewText:
I loved the original Carmageddon games... And as a fan of the oldies I am trying my absolute best to enjoy reincarnation... I really am.. Take this from someone who finished the first 2 multiple times and had a blast while doing so..

....But this....The handling... Oh my god it's just completely ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•en ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•.

Basically the only way to kill enemies apart from sheer luck and frustration is Opponent Repulsificator, Anvil Launcher.. Maybe mines... I dunno.. Just powerups that you might accidentally sliiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiide into by luck or chance...

The driving to kill without powerups is just infuriating and boring because the cars handle like absolute dung, worse than the original games which were noted for having poor handling (WHICH I LOVED) but I just cannot grit my teeth and say that it's okay. It's just not okay and it's not fun and this totally destroys the game for me.

Oh that and the uninspired level design which lacks the fun little hidden hidey holes and easter eggs that were abundant in the originals.. Shame :(

And oh god, the handling... Just imagine you are on ice all the time, then suddenly you drive onto actual ice in the game and that feels like double ice... I'd say it feels like you're driving a boat but boats handle better than this and at least water has friction.

It makes me so ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, just ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•en BAH HUMBUG!!!

Oh, and the forum on their website is full of trolls and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•s. That place needs moderation because a community like that will kill itself pretty quick.

Complain about something and all you get is Git Gud" like it's a case of good or bad. Completing this game isn't hard
date: it's just ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•en boring. What a total let down and a bunch of dunce hat wearing ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•s left on their official community."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Carmageddon, definitely my favorite driving game of all time. Loved the original, quirks and all, and really like this current incarnation. Nothings better for blowing off a little steam at the end of a rough day.

That said there are some issues currently, this game ran near flawless for me for months, until the recent patch, now I can't even launch it. Hopefully the developers are working on a fix for those of us affected by this new little hiccup. So if you are looking for a fun and silly racing game this will fit the bill. If you don't want the silliness and gore, then this might not be the game for you.

Early Access Review

played it not much so far, but still it is what i expected! Carmageddon is back and it is AWESOME!

Pros:
+Violence
+senseless Violence
+good controller support
+hilarious gamemodes
+blood and gore as you'd wish it for a Carmageddon game
+did i say violence?
+huge arsenal of funny, stupid and amazing PUps!

Cons:
-at this point hard to get a decent Framerate (im at ~20-25 FPS), without having to reduce the graphics to an absolute minimum
-takes you some time to get used to the menu, since it is not quite intuitive (at least for me)

TL;DR version:
Buy it if you want loads of Violence, Gamemodes and Weapons at the cost of your Framerate!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis late in the development process, and the full release around the corner, you'd think the game would be playable. I can run the game fine. It is beta however. I am not expecting it to be really optimized at this point. The cars themselves are why I will not reccomend anyone purchasing this game. Towmeister. Sure, its heavy. But the darn thing handles like the tires are greased all of the time. If you hit the E-brake and slide while doing 30mph you will slide a good 100ft before coming to a complete stop. Caddy-fat-cat imo was the best handling car in the original Carmageddon. It was low to the ground and wide. It handled very well. Its still low, and wide but it does not handle worth a darn. I absolutely hate the handling of every single vehicle in this game. None perform very well excpet for the Eagle. Good luck wrecking a cop, or an APC with it.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e8sQza6plVE

Text:
Carmageddon is one of the games which released an enormous storm around violence against pedestrians and got a huge media attention what ultimately led to more publicity. A racing game where we drive over pedestrians to win? MADNESS! CRAZY! PROHIBITED!

Today that is no longer really relevant, since we run over pedestrians in any GTA.

Classic Karma is the one thing that seperates it.

Classic Karma is a race against 5 computer opponents and a victory can be achieved via one of 3 possible events. First, of course, can be run and who arrives first at the finish the race ends with a win.. Then all enemies can be destroyed through various upgrades, crashes and weapons that we can pick up. And as a last option we can roadkill a certain amount of pedestrians to win. It makes no sense why one should win a race this way, but well‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a videogame.

It is this mode that made Carmageddon famous, hated, loved and unique. Now with Carmageddon Reincarnation in 2015 this unique race fuuuuun" returns.

But unfortunately completely not in the quality that I would have liked.

Let's talk about the elephant in the room: the performance. Maybe you've heard it from other YouTubers
date: but the game runs like a slide show. Not a particularly nice on if I might add. No matter what setting

reviewText:
UPDATE 2: No update since release, game still broken...


UPDATE: Even after release the performance issue still remain!





Cannot recommend this right now, specially at full price.

The game itself is what you would expect from the series (if not a little stagnant, I wish they had added something new to this old formula) lots of car crashes, pedestrian road kills, checkpoint racing against the clock. Complete and total mayhem!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Huge fan of the originals back in the day.   However, while this does stay somewhat true to those games it also doesnt innovate in any way.  Racing games/controls/physics have come a long way and this game doesnt adopt any tech or quality of life improvements to the genre over the last 15 years.    This can be seen as good or bad by some.

Straight to the point the game is about to come out of beta and has terrible issues with crash's.  I've crash's just for changing the key bindings.  Load times are slow, i have a 780 gtx and the new x99 chipset and the latest haswell E processor and 32 gigs of ddr 4 ram running it on solid state.  There is no reason for the load times, the game is hilariously badly optimized for something that has been developed for as long as it has.

This is further annoying because the game graphically looks like something that was released over 6-7 yeears ago.  I put everything on max settings and while my computer handles it I noticed several graphical artifacts like lines putruding out of buildings and strange graphical glitch's with the car parts.    They're not contant but they happen frequent enough to make you even more confused why the game is such a resource hog.

Honestly i'm curious what the point of this game was.   If i wanted to play carmegeddon with outdated graphics and the same old sloppy handling and physics, i'd have just played the original carmegeddon games.   Glad to see they're trying to bring it back, but at this point i think another developer should have took over the series as some how over the last decade all they thought that could improve the game is multiplayer.

Sadly dissapointed, also I didnt play the game 39 hours, thats a glitch with steam and this game.  I ran several other games in that time, it just kept telling everyone i was in carmegeddon.....add that to the list of weird bugs with this game.   In short, want carmegeddon?  Go play the originals and save yourself the time on this.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Even though I found some good things in this game, I just cannot recommend it.

The fun here was too little and occasionally it was downright frustrating.

The handling is horrible, it is like balancing an upright pencil on the tip of your finger. Yes, driving has similarities with previous games but not quite (played little oldies to verify). Given the car mass and acceleration such handling might be expected but Carmageddon is not the kind of game where I anticipate realistic simulation. Eventually after hours of practice you can master the fat cows on ice but it is not the entertainment to go back for occasional relaxing wrecking and mayhem. Where is the fun in not being able to hit anything you want, rather constantly spinning out of countrol. And it is not only handling what has suffered through too much realism but also overall game balance. Often the opponents are very aggressive and with weaker vehicle you are constantly wasted or your wheels are missing. Timed power-ups last not enough to do anything.

This game introduced some new game modes, those might be good for multiplayer but in single-player it felt like filling the lack of content. Original Carmageddon had no missions or challenges, the second game had one for every three ‚Äòclassic‚Äô levels, but current one has one to three ratio favouring challenges. Again, not fun.

Lots of reviews are pointing to technical issues. I tried it while it was Early Access and then it was real slide-show. Currently it ran smooth, loading times were bit long but some moving level physics like crusher plate threw everything skipping, also playback mode was unusably slow. There were other small issues but nothing annoying: level disappearing at certain camera angle, overlapping geometry, prop placements, etc. Some achievements are declared broken and cause multiplayer is pretty much dead, no way to get those achievements either.

I think lot of people who spent hours or days in previous Carmageddons hoped to get something more. With no players there probably will be no viable modding community and custom content creation either.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At its current state, this game spits on all the things which made Carmageddon great.

Let me start off by saying this: The game has been given an official release date in April. That's less than a month away. At the moment of writing this, the game takes a LONG time to boot up. If it even boots at all. If you're lucky enough to get it running, you're then treated to an atrociously long load time before you can get into the first level. But hey, a long load time before the actual gameplay must mean we get a big open world to play around in, right?

Wrong.

All of the levels (that I played so far) are average-sized at best, and feel uninspired and bland. The few creative pieces of level design that are present, are ripped off from the original Carmageddon. And even those feel like a poor man's choice.

But come on, it's Carmageddon! Surely we can deal with some longer load times. After all, we've been waiting for so many years!

The thing is, this doesn't FEEL like a Carmageddon game, but rather like a cheap knockoff. Remember that sense of speed and accomplishment you got in the original, from racing down those long stretches of road, only to ram into a pedestrian or vehicle at over 200 mph? Well, don't expect any of that here. All of the cars feel incredibly slow, where even the faster models give you no sense of speed at all.

But then again, going over 200 mph in THIS game would be absolute suicide, since all of the cars seem to be made out of paper. The slightest nudge to your car will make your repair indicator go haywire. Your opponents' cars don't fare much better. All of the intensity that came with the battles in the original Carmageddon is gone in this one, simply because a little lovetap is enough to send most of your opponents out of commission.

Also, driving in itself is an absolute disaster. You'll spend more time trying to keep your car going in a straight line than anything else. Nudge your analog stick to the left or right? Be prepared to fight a long battle with your car in order NOT to crash it. There is little to no friction with the road.

The horrible driving mechanics are even more of a hassle because of the terrible, TERRIBLE optimisation. Be prepared for fps drops. A LOT of fps drops. At random. Don't you just love it when a supposedly fast-paced game decides to further screw you over by randomly freezing up for a few seconds in the midst of what little action there is?

Game modes... The classic Carmageddon formula is here: Kill your opponents, kill all pedestrians or just do the race. Due to all of the reasons mentioned above, there's little enjoyment left in this once great formula. There are also some new game modes, which are completely unnecessary. Why add a race mode, when this is included in the classic" mode? Basically
date: the game is saying "do classic mode
recommended: but we're taking away your choice in the matter and you have to do the racing thing that NOBODY EVERY DOES IN A CARMAGEDDON GAME". There's also a checkpoint mode
hoursPlayed: where you have to collect 10 checkpoints before the opponents do. Yes
voteText: it's exactly as stupid as it sounds.\n\nGraphically... meh. The game looks dated
helpfulPercent: with some very questionable texture quality at some places
votesHelpful: and is plagued with invincible obstacles. Drive full speed into a bench? That bench will **** you up good and not budge an inch. But not all benches. Some of them are destructible. Some of them aren't. Feeling lucky? And there's a lot more of these where that came from.\n\nIt's a shame this game turned out the way it did. With less than a month before its official release
votesTotal: I don't see this becoming a worthy Carmageddon game in time. Maybe after a few (or rather
votesFunny: a lot) of updates
commentsCount: it might get there.\n\nBut right now? Save your time and money

For fans of the original Carmageddon, like myself, this is a very refreshing, and real, update to a game we've loved for years. everything from the handling of the cars to the splattering of pedestrians feels like it did so many years ago, but with a beautiful fresh face to make it look like it should in today's field.

The pieces returning to your car when you repair, from wherever they end up, are a nice touch to boot.

Personally, i was happy to see it even EXIST, with the travesty that TDR2k made of the game. This is one, given a little bug fixing, very near to it's current state, is worth a purchase.

reviewText:
You did it, Stainless. You did it.
You brought Carmageddon back, updated to todays standards and just as hilarious as the original.
Car physics and damage are fantastic, graphics are great and the music is very fitting and energetic. I've had hours of fun racing so far. As soon as a race is finished I just want to start the next one as soon as possible.
The different racing modes makes the game more varied and even more fun, and with a spiced up arsenal of power ups such as the anvil launcher, you can be sure that Carmageddon stands out from the crowd.

Any fan of the original Carmageddon 1 from 1997 will feel right at home in the driver's seat with Reincarnation!

I thank you, Stainless Games, for bringing us this sweet pack known as Carmageddon.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a blast from the past in a very good and upgraded way.
YES there are issues currently but it is in a pre-release state. As long as certain issues are ironed out in time for full release or even in a first week patch then my review will remain positive.

If however the problems persist after general release then I will be disapointed to say the least.

First off, Loading times. I suggest putting the kettle on or start on your GoT box set.

Graphics, I would like to think i have a decent system. after all I play Far Cry 4 and Watchdogs with everything on max.
Carma however has graphics issues. even on very low settings. I would really love for the developers to sort this out before proper release because I am of the opinion it could be a very good looking game indeed. It is the kind of game that needs to be faced paced and hectic and at the moment I am afraid frame rates are not helping things.

Overall - Positive. Not for what it is NOW, but what it has the potential to be (hopefully very soon)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI've been playing this game since the alpha, and let me tell you I'm glad I kickstarted this game. This is exactly what I was looking forward to, a new Carmageddon complete with the same controls and lots of gore. If you're unfamiliar with Carmagedoon, it's a game where you do what you want. Wanna just race? Sure. Wanna kill all the peds? Go right ahead. Wanna smash everyone to pieces? Your choice. And best of all? No ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•t in between except for the long load times, but I'm sure that's being worked on while it's still in early access. This is a good game and it's worth 30 buckaroonies.

reviewText:
11/4/2015 - The game is much more optomized. The loading times are a little better.  I clocked about a minute to load a map which is better than before.  The smoothness of the gameplay is much better and fps gains are great adding to the smoothness.  The graphics are also much more enhanced and better looking.  Classic gameplay.  If you love cars and destruction and an open world, this game is for you.

Let's be honest right now.  As of 3/11/2015 at 11:31am est, this game is buggy as hell and not very optomized.  The graphics are horribly optomized.  You can't use bloom or AA without the game just going to a crawl and that is coming from a person with the specs (amd 8350 oc, nvidia 770 oc, 16gb ram, 512ssd).  If you put the graphics up it still doesn't look that good.  I actually found that removing the bloom, blur, dof, and others that it looks much better.  I enable AA in my nvidia control panel.

The game is horribly buggy.  At first I had to install a windows update for it to even run.  Then the very first match i tried to get into bugged me out to the desktop.  That was not a good sign.  Then the next match worked but boy did it take forever to get into. Like a minute or two to load and I am use to a few seconds with an ssd for my games.  I get into the game and the game runs well once it is playing.  The peds look great and so do the cars.  It plays very much like the games of the past which is what redeems the game itself.  That is what I was really looking for.  It's that yea sure there is a course to run
date: but Imma go see what is on top of this building...let me get wall climber and speed boost and drive up there."  or the "Imma try and kill every ped in the game" or "lets just explore and see how much air time I can get off that ramp."  The open world
hoursPlayed: crazy fun
voteText:
car smashing chaos that you come to expect from the series.  It is still there alive and strong.  Very fun.  The sounds even bring you back to the days of ol' glory.  Tons of fun once you get it to play.

Tip: when loading just leave it be.  It takes a while but it will eventually load.  Don't start pushing buttons thinking it has crashed.

IN THE END: If you don't mind some serious bugs trying to get the game started and love the classic carmageddon experience
helpfulPercent: buy the game.  The devs seem to be constantly working on it and will iron out the bugs...and if they don't I know without a doubt that the community will."

reviewText:
Well, i'am sure that everybody already knows this: This game runs like ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, and the graphics are not that good looking to justify that. My hardware:

Amd FX-8370 8 core 4ghz
Gpu: Nvidia Gtx 760 4Gb
Ram 16gb
Mb M5A97 R2.0

So this game run in 1980x1080 medium settings about 25-50fps max. So not nearly as good as it should run.
But the main question besides the awful performance, is this game any fun and is it good?

When this game runs +45fps it's really a good game, reminds me a lot about old carmageddon, only with a better graphics and more destruction details.

I can truly say that i like this game, despite it's runnning poorly. When you slam someone to the wall and see parts flying around, i instantly thing Good old carmageddon"

Gameplay wise
